music.title: Sounds and Beats
music.content: Children learn about sounds around them and how beats make music fun. They clap, tap, and listen carefully.
examples: Tap on the table like a drum 🥁

music.title: Singing Simple Songs
music.content: Pupils sing short songs like 'Twinkle Twinkle Little Star' and learn melody.

music.title: Dancing with Music
music.content: Children move their bodies to the rhythm of music, learning coordination and fun expression.

music.title: Clapping Games
music.content: Pupils clap in rhythm to develop timing and teamwork.

music.title: Listening to Instruments
music.content: Children listen to different sounds of drums, flutes, and xylophones.

music.title: Singing in Groups
music.content: Pupils sing together to build teamwork and harmony.
examples: Sing 'If you’re happy' as a group 😀

music.title: Making Music with Objects
music.content: Children use sticks, bottle tops, and cans to create rhythms.
examples: Shake a bottle filled with stones 🔔

music.title: Fast and Slow Songs
music.content: Children sing fast songs and slow songs to understand tempo.

music.title: Quiet and Loud Music
music.content: Pupils learn the difference between soft and loud sounds.

music.title: Music and Feelings
music.content: Children explore how music can make them happy, calm, or excited.

rhymes.title: Nursery Rhymes
rhymes.content: Children learn popular rhymes to improve memory and rhythm.

rhymes.title: Action Rhymes
rhymes.content: Pupils do hand movements with rhymes to connect body and mind.

rhymes.title: Animal Rhymes
rhymes.content: Rhymes about animals make learning fun and imaginative.

rhymes.title: Counting Rhymes
rhymes.content: Children sing rhymes that teach numbers and counting.

rhymes.title: Bedtime Rhymes
rhymes.content: Soft rhymes to help children relax before sleep.

rhymes.title: Playground Rhymes
rhymes.content: Fun rhymes chanted during playtime with friends.

rhymes.title: Family Rhymes
rhymes.content: Rhymes that mention parents, siblings, and family love.

rhymes.title: Weather Rhymes
rhymes.content: Children sing about rain, sun, and wind.

rhymes.title: Food Rhymes
rhymes.content: Rhymes about fruits and meals that children enjoy.

rhymes.title: Holiday Rhymes
rhymes.content: Special rhymes for Christmas, Eid, and festivals.
examples: We Wish You a Merry Christmas 🎄

current_affairs.title: My Country
current_affairs.content: Children learn the name of their country, the president, and national flag.

current_affairs.title: Important Places
current_affairs.content: Pupils know important places like markets, schools, hospitals, and post offices.

current_affairs.title: Leaders
current_affairs.content: Pupils learn about leaders like the president, governor, and local chiefs.

current_affairs.title: National Symbols
current_affairs.content: Children identify the flag, coat of arms, and anthem.

current_affairs.title: Transport
current_affairs.content: Pupils learn about cars, buses, boats, and airplanes used in daily life.

current_affairs.title: National Holidays
current_affairs.content: Children know holidays like Independence Day and Children’s Day.

current_affairs.title: Important Buildings
current_affairs.content: Pupils learn about schools, mosques, churches, and government offices.

current_affairs.title: National Heroes
current_affairs.content: Children know great men and women who helped their country.

current_affairs.title: Daily News
current_affairs.content: Pupils talk about simple news from radio or TV in class.

current_affairs.title: Our Currency
current_affairs.content: Children learn about the Naira notes and coins.
